page.title: 08Transport
page.content: Transport is entirely by road, all heavy goods being moved by wagons including timber and consumer goods. Most travellers use private cars, public transport being very limited. The{Ribble Bus Company}runs a scheduled service connecting Hawkshead, Ambleside, Coniston and Ulverston. There are buses four times daily throughout the year and two extra in the summer season. An extra service is run on Wednesday to the Windermere ferry and on Thursday to Ulverson for market. The roads, being narrow, become very congested during the summer season and the large car park is often full. The{Mountain Goat, a private company, provides daily tours to Hawkshead and Tarn Hows from Keswick and Windermere during the summer season. School transport from outlying districts is by minibus.
